sponsor.partnerMessage: Big Box Karaoke in Fayetteville has 7 private rooms to sing, eat, and drink with your closest friends and family. Perfect for adult and kids birthday parties, bachelorette parties, girls night out, corporate events, team building, and more! Book a Box and sing your heart out!

posts.title: Northwest Arkansas On Top Ten Watchlist For Real Estate In 2023
posts.content:
The National Association of Realtors released their 2023 housing forecast, naming Northwest Arkansas among the top ten markets to watch in 2023.

  • Moving up: Demand continues to outpace supply in the housing market, and economic conditions in the top 10 markets suggest home prices could rise by at least 5% in 2023.
  • Reasoning: The NAR chose its top ten, of which NWA ranked fourth, based on economic indicators like housing affordability, job growth, population growth, and more.

Read more on the story HERE.

posts.title: NBA Star Jimmy Butler And Onyx Coffee Labs Partner On Specialty Drink
posts.content:
Six-time All-Star NBA player and coffee entrepreneur Jimmy Butler has partnered with Onyx Coffee Labs on a limited edition coffee release for his BIGFACE coffee brand.

  • The process: Butler and Onyx co-founders Jon and Andrea Allen chose an award-winning Gesha coffee from the La Palma y El Tuc√°n farm in Columbia that uses a unique process involving a 100-hour pre-fermentation resulting in a complex cup with tropical notes.
  • Box out: The limited edition BIGFACE x ONYX Gesha coffee box set is $200 and includes an 8 oz bag of coffee and a 12 oz mug.

Read more about the collaboration HERE.

posts.title: Weekend Roundup
posts.content:
Take a look at these ideas to make the most of the last weekend before Christmas!

  • Pass the popcorn: This weekend, Malco Razorback Cinema will host a limited release of Mindcage, a crime thriller filmed in Fayetteville starring Martin Lawrence and John Malkovich.
  • Gift Shopping: Take advantage of the last weekend of holiday markets in Fayetteville to wrap up your gift list.
  • Holly Joggy Christmas: The Botanical Garden of the Ozarks is hosting the 10th annual Jingle Bell Jog on Saturday, Dec 17, with a 5K beginning at 9a and a Children's Fun Run at 10a.
  • Merry Chrysler: Enjoy cookies, cocoa, and free crafts with Santa and Santa Paws therapy dogs at Lewis Automotive Group in Fayetteville this Saturday, Dec 17, from 10a-1p.
  • Wreaths of honor: The Fayetteville National Cemetary will decorate memorial stones for Wreaths Across America on Saturday, Dec 17, from 10a-12p. Sign up here if you want to place your own wreath on the grave of a loved one.
  • Swing, batter, batter: Reserve an indoor batting cage with friends at Arvest Ball Park, and try not to strike out!
  • Concert hopping: Take a look at these exciting shows happening at venues all over NWA this weekend.
  • Last chance: Fifteen local makers are hosting a Last Minute Market full of locally crafted goods at 6302 Wilkerson Street in Fayetteville from 10a-4p on Sunday, Dec 18.

Enjoy yourselves, Northwest Arkansas! We'll see you Monday.

posts.title: Bentonville Selected As Home Of USA National Mountain Bike Team
posts.content:
USA Cycling announced Bentonville as the official home of the United States National Mountain Bike Team.

  • Preparation: The extensive network of singletrack trails and gravel roads in Northwest Arkansas will serve as training grounds as athletes prepare to take gold at the 2028 Olympic Games.
  • Start em young: Along with serving as the center for mountain bike operations, the Bentonville-based office of USA Cycling will also become the national base for its collegiate cycling operations, developing up-and-coming riders for the future of the sport.

Read the full story on Business Wire HERE.

posts.title: Cool Jobs in NWA
posts.content:
Looking for a job? Check out these positions posted to our community board:

  • Lifewater International has a position open for a Grants and Foundations Manager
  • Ropeswing Hospitality Group is looking for an Sous Chef at Louise Cafe.

Have a job you're looking to fill? Post it here!

pick.title: NWA Daily Picks
pick.content:
• Hug in A Mug: Enjoy games, crafts, & photos with Santa this Sunday from 4-7p at TheatreSquared's Hot Cocoa Social. Free and open to the public, but reservations are recommended.*
  • A perfect match: Some families get matching pajamas for the holidays, so why not add matching t-shirts from Natural Threads? Use code NWADAILY at checkout to enjoy 20% off.*
  • Refinance: A report by California-based Attom Data Solutions reveals mortgage activity in Northwest Arkansas is at a 3-year low.
  • Changing scenery: Are you thinking about selling your home or property? We can connect you with someone to help. Drop us a message if so!
  • Naturals: Arvest Ballpark in Springdale will be the location for the final round of the 2023 GAC Baseball Championships beginning May 11.
  • What's your story:  We'd love to feature your story in our newsletter! Check out our deals HERE.

*Content is sponsored
